metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7555 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Augeas versions up to and including 1.8.0 are vulnerable to heap-basedbuffer overflow due to improper handling of escaped strings. Attacker couldsend crafted strings that would cause the application using augeas to copypast the end of a buffer, leading to a crash or possible code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7555` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

augeas-lenses - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.3
augeas-tools - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.3
libaugeas0 - 1.2.0-0ubuntu1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: augeas package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.0-0ubuntu1.3').
